intro: Senecio adscendens, commonly known as the ascending groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio adscendens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
